reasoning: Chronic pain syndrome is a heterogeneous umbrella term with prevalence estimates ranging 15-30% globally (~150,000 per 100k). Using prevalence rather than incidence, as onset is often ill-defined. Limited by vague definition and wide variation in diagnostic criteria.
source: Treede RD et al. (2015). Chronic pain as a symptom or a disease: the IASP classification of chronic pain for the ICD-11. Pain. 160(1):19-27
